intro: Canthiumera robusta, commonly known as the robust canthium, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and large, palmate leaves that can reach up to 30 cm in diameter. Its showy yellow flowers are clustered in inflorescences and bloom during the rainy season. Canthiumera robusta is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and swampy areas.
